alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 12:52PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WARM AND WET CONDITIONS TO SOUTHWEST ALASKA MIDWEEK... A series of storms moving from the Bering Sea to the Chukchi Sea Tuesday through Thursday will bring southerly winds, warm temperatures, and mixed precipitation to Southwest Alaska next week. Expect temperatures to climb into the mid to upper 30s as far north as the Lower Kuskokwim Valley as moderate southerly winds move into the region. Peak winds will move through the Kuskokwim Delta at 30 to 40 mph, with gusts to 45 mph are expected Tuesday. Breezy conditions will continue through Wednesday and Thursday, but to a lesser magnitude. The precipitation type from snow to rain, along with the onset timing, as temperatures quickly shift above freezing remains uncertain. Freezing rain and rain freezing to already cold surfaces cannot be ruled out for some locations either. With warmer air continuing to filter through the Southwest Alaska with each successive storm, the transition period for precipitation type should be brief. This forecast will continue to evolve, so please stay tuned at weather.gov/afc as we refine the details.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
